feed.subtitle: SAP Community Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Incorrect Creation Time Displayed in Billing Document (VF01), Sales Document(VA01) Etc.
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We are facing an issue related to document creation time in our SAP system.

For example:

  • Today (03/10/2025) at 05:51 PM (local system time), I created a billing document.

  • After creation, when I display the billing document in VF03, the creation time shown is 12:28 PM instead of the actual time when the billing was created.

This issue is not limited to one user ‚Äì it is happening for all clients in our system during sales order creation, delivery, and billing document creation.

Our business requirement is to capture and display the exact creation time of the document. Could you please advise:

  1. Why is there a mismatch between the actual creation time and the time displayed in VF03?

  2. Is this related to time zone settings (user profile/system/application server)?

  3. What is the recommended way to rectify this issue so that the correct creation time is displayed?

Any guidance or best practices to resolve this will be highly appreciated.

Thank you,
Tharmaraj S

entry.title: SAP For Purchasing
entry.content:
Good Morning,

I have recently been workforce reduced, AGAIN. That's twice in 17 months.

As I seek new opportunities I am being asked about my SAP experience and usage.

Since 1990 I have learned and used multiple computerized inventory softwares.

What makes SAP any better than other programs? Is it more useful? What are the benefits? How is it used in purchasing? Are there visual examples I can access to see how it is used in purchasing.

If anyone does respond, please be straightforward with plain talk.

Thank You.

entry.title: Calling All Aspiring SAP Consultants! üöÄ Linkedin Group
entry.content:
Are you starting your SAP journey or transitioning into SAP consulting? I've just launched a LinkedIn group specifically for professionals like us who are building their SAP careers.

Why you should Join:

  • Students preparing for SAP certifications
  • Career changers exploring SAP consulting
  • Recent graduates seeking their first SAP role
  • Anyone looking to connect with peers at a similar stage

What we'll share:

  • Study resources and certification tips
  • Job opportunities and career advice
  • Real-world project experiences
  • Networking and mentorship connections
  • Module-specific discussions (MM, SD, FICO, IS-H, and more)

Why join? Breaking into SAP can feel overwhelming‚Äînavigating certifications, choosing modules, finding opportunities. This group is a supportive space where we can learn together, share resources, and help each other succeed.

Join us here: ***REMOVED BY MODERATION

Whether you're just discovering SAP or actively building your consulting skills, let's connect and grow together!  

Feel free to share this with anyone who might benefit. See you in the group

#SAP #SAPConsultant #SAPCommunity #SAPCareers #SAPTraining #CareerDevelopment #SAPJourney

entry.title: MRP TYPE
entry.content:
Hi I am new to SAP, i have been looking at some Maintenance Item set up and there are items for example 

MRP Type ZB with Max 3 and ROP 1 but there is no LOT size and

MRP Type TB with Max 5 and ROP = 3 again no LOT SIZE

I have looked in a SAP Press book but there is no mention of ZB and TB can any one tell what they mean and should there be a LOT type I thought HB was used when ROP & Max are populated

IN MY TASK LIST, DON¬¥T USE ANY MATERIAL, ONLY USE WORK CENTER

entry.title: Certificate / Digital Badge Not Received
entry.content:
I recently passed my SAP certification exam, C_BCSBS_2502 (Positioning SAP Business Suite), on 16 October 2025 with 70%, but I have not yet received my certificate or digital badge.

 

I have already submitted a ticket (5000233204), but there has been no response from the support team so far.

 

I am a bit worried because my friend, who passed on the same day as me, received their certificate within a few minutes after completing the exam.

 

Could anyone from the SAP community please advise what I should do now? Any contacts or guidance would be greatly appreciated.

Best regards,

Sirada Thanee

Certification

entry.title: Record of Achievement Badge Link Redirects to Previous Badge
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I successfully completed the course ‚ÄúExploring Localisation as a Self-Service with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition‚Äù on learning.sap.com. I also received a confirmation email about the completion.

However, when I click ‚ÄúView Badge‚Äù on my profile, it redirects to my previous badge instead of showing the new one for this course.

The badges are issued through Credly by Pearson, so I checked there as well, but the new badge has not appeared yet.

Has anyone else experienced this issue? How long does it usually take for a new badge to appear? Do you know any solution for this?

Thank you for your help!

Best regards,
Buddini

entry.title: Subject: Escalation Request ‚Äì Digital Badge and Certificate Not Received for Completed Course Dear

Thank you for your support and attention.

Kind regards,
Sandeepa Jayasinghe

entry.title: Suggestion: Link the linked accounts
entry.content:
(I tried to start this as a suggestion, but it seems I have no enough privileges, so I must bother you with a normal post)

So I had this account for years, since I fell in the SAP world circa 2004. It's linked to my personal e-mail account, and I want to keep it that way to preserve my sad and useless history of contributions here. Because it's a personal one, it's a P account. No problem with that.

But as I need to keep working with SAP, my company registered me another account linked to my company e-mail address. Because it's a professional one, and I assume my company pays for it somehow, it's an S account. Nice.

What's my problem? I join everyday here with my P account, I dig for info, and sometimes I find someone telling "check the XXXX note". So I go to me.sap.com to check that note and... I have no authorization there. I check my account info and I see both accounts linked, but the system is uncapable of decide that if I am in the support section, I must be treated as an S account, and treat me as a P account while in the community one.

So I must log out, log in again and keep doing that every day.

Please, try to change that behaviour to allow us with linked S&P accounts to be treated according to the section.

(it's curious how the post changed when I noticed "treat" comes without "h")

entry.title: API Execution Failed When Trying to Use ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù Feature in SAP Cloud Integration API on BTP Trial
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I recently ran into an issue while experimenting with SAP Cloud Integration on my SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) Trial Account, and I wanted to share my experience here in case anyone else has faced something similar‚Äîor if someone can point me in the right direction.

Scenario

As part of my learning journey in SAP Integration Suite, I created an Integration Flow (iFlow) in Cloud Integration (CPI) and successfully deployed it.

Then, I exposed the iFlow as an API through the API Management capability of BTP so that I could access it externally via a REST API call.

Everything went smoothly until I tried to test the API using the ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù feature from SAP API Business Hub.

Steps Followed

  1. Logged in to my SAP BTP Trial account.

  2. Opened Integration Suite ‚Üí Cloud Integration.

  3. Created and deployed an iFlow that returns some sample data.

  4. Exposed the iFlow as an API Proxy using API Management ‚Üí Design ‚Üí API Proxies.

  5. Opened the Cloud Integration API package on SAP API Business Hub.

  6. Clicked ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù to test one of the APIs (for example, /MessageProcessingLogs).

  7. Given the clientid and clientsecret from instance default_it-rt_integration-flow and also I tried with my BTP sign inuser id and password and it shows API execution failed. Please try again.

    Issue Facing

    When I clicked Execute, the system returned the following message:

    API execution failed. Please try again.

    No additional error details were displayed in the response window, and the API call did not reach my iFlow endpoint.

    Troubleshooting Attempted

    Here‚Äôs what I‚Äôve tried so far:

    • Verified that the iFlow is deployed and active.

    • Checked the runtime URL from the Monitor ‚Üí Manage Integration Content page.

    • Verified that my trial tenant is active and not in suspended state.

    • Checked API Business Hub ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù feature for other packages ‚Äî same issue occurs, which might indicate an environment limitation.

      My Understanding So Far

      It seems that the ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù feature on SAP API Business Hub might not support BTP Trial environments for certain APIs, especially those requiring authenticated connections to Cloud Integration runtime.

      In a productive BTP setup (non-trial), the ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù function usually works fine when proper credentials and destinations are configured.

      Request for Help

      Has anyone successfully used the Cloud Integration API ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù feature with a Trial account?
      If so, could you please share:

      • Any specific configuration or destination settings needed for trial accounts

      • Whether OAuth token-based authentication is mandatory

      • Or if this limitation is by design for BTP Trial users

        Conclusion

        I‚Äôm learning a lot about SAP Integration Suite and the API Management capabilities on BTP.
        Even though I‚Äôve hit this roadblock, it‚Äôs been a great opportunity to understand how authentication and API exposure work behind the scenes in the SAP ecosystem.

        Would love to hear from the community if anyone has faced and resolved this issue! üôå

entry.title: job_output_info getting empty
entry.content:
i am working on one project that has module pool program in that one screen and one button.

i am suffering to solve error is that job_output_info is empty when i run program then first print preview dialog open and when i come back from print preview job_output_info is empty.

ls_control-no_dialog = 'X'.
ls_control-preview = ' '.
ls_control-no_open = ' '.
ls_control-no_close = 'X'.
ls_control-getotf = 'X'.
ls_control-device = 'PRINTER'.
ls_output-tddest = 'LP01'.
ls_output-tddataset = 'BOH'.
ls_output-tdsuffix2 = 'HEALTH LETTR'.

CALL FUNCTION lv_name
EXPORTING
control_parameter = ls_control
output_options = ls_output
user_settings = ' '
payslip_id = ph11-payslip_id
emp_dept_data = emp_dept_data
IMPORTING
job_output_info = ls_job_output_info
TABLES
itab_emp_payslip_ite3 = itab_emp_payslip_ite3.
